description: Maximum number of K4's (complete 4 graphs) a graph can contain if it contains at most n distinct K3's (triangles).
references: Robert Cowen (cowen(AT)qcvaxa.acc.qc.edu) and Bill Emerson, On finding $k\sb 4 (k\sb 3 <= x)$. New York Graph Theory Day, 34 (1997). Graph Theory Notes N. Y. 34 (1998), 26-30.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
